intro: Urobotrya sparsiflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in summer and attract various pollinators. Urobotrya sparsiflora is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
